constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 57 (Friday, March 26, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. GOOD of Virginia:
H.R. 2218.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
This legislation adjusts the formula the federal government
uses to spend money on federal contracts, therefore, it is
authorized by the Constitution under Article 1, Section 8,
Clause 1, which grants Congress its spending authority.
[Page H1693]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

title: Davis-Bacon Repeal Act
